result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) and Operating w/PAC-Passenger <16 Yrs(2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) and the other charge, Operating w/PAC-Passenger <16 Yrs(2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Maureen O. Swade was found guilty of OWI (2nd w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Maureen O. Swade was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  Pay fine of $450.00 and court costs including all applicable surcharges - for Ct 1.   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges - for Ct 5.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharges.

timeConds.notes: AS A CONDITION OF PROBATION.  Huber and Work Crew authorized. Unless work crew is expressly prohibited by the Court, an inmate serving time as a condition of probation is eligible for work crew and may receive a credit of one day for every 3 days of work performed. Electronic Leg Monitor not allowed.

AS A CONDITION OF PROBATION  -  Commence forthwith  -  Huber is authorized for family care and employment.   **
***JOC is amended as follows:  Court has no opposition to the jail placing the DE on ELM only while out on huber. ***
***
****JOC is amended on 11-28-17 to show that she is ordered to serve 123 days not 94 days***

for Modification of Sentencing; DE's report date to the KCJ is modified to 7/9/16 at 8:00 AM.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge
Bench Warrant vacated w/ Laura in Joint Services /pt

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Maureen O. Swade, appeared with Attorney Frederick L. Zievers.  Clerk: PT.
Court vacates bench warrant and reinstates bond.     Case is resolved.  Counts 1 & 5 - DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Counts 2, 3, 4 and 6 are Dismissed by the State.  14CM1447 & 16CM754 read in.  Sentencing arguments made.  Court imposes and stays 90 days in the KCJ w/ Huber on Count 1 only;   Sentence is withheld on both Count 1 and Count 5 and DE is placed on probation for 18 months with conditions.  As a condition court imposes 60 days in the KCJ commencing on 7/2/16 at 8:00 AM.  Huber & Work Crew is authorized, but DE is not eligible for the electronic leg monitor.    Court imposes a fine of $450 plus costs & surcharge in Count 1, plus costs & surcharge only in Count 5.  Any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  DE's driving privileges are revoked for 16 months.  AODA Assessment & Ignition Interlock ordered.   Appeal Rights given.
